page.title: 12Allison Uttley
page.content: Alison Uttley was born as Alice Taylor in December 1884, at Castletop Farm, near Cromford. Daily she walked to{Lea School}through{Bow Wood,}and that was where she got the ideas for her stories. When she was nineteen she went to Manchester to study physics. Then she took a teacher training course in Cambridge. After that she left for Northern England and eventually married James Uttley.{'The Little Grey {Rabbit'}stories were used to tell to her son, about her childhood at Castletop farm. Her first book{,'The Country Child' was rejected by a publisher. Then her husband died leaving Alison without any money. She sent the{,'Country {Child'}to some more publishers and it was eventually accepted. She then then became a successful childrens author.
